Ad Text:
Technical Product Manager

At Optus, we're building the next generation of data innovation and transformation, and we're looking for a technical leader to shape the future of our Business Intelligence ecosystem. Joining as Technical Product Manager, you'll play a pivotal role in driving strategy, execution, and adoption of BI capabilities across our enterprise data platform


The day to day

Support the execution of our data transformation roadmap by leading key BI initiatives and milestones.

Own and evolve the BI capability roadmap with a focus on Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, and the responsible sunset of Tableau.

Lead and manage the enterprise migration from Tableau to Power BI — driving impact analysis, stakeholder communication, report rationalisation, and user enablement.

Design and implement a scalable, governed, and self-service BI architecture aligned with Optus' data strategy.

Integrate AI-driven capabilities (e.g., Power BI Copilot, natural language queries, automated insights) to deliver smarter, faster decision-making.

Partner with business and analytics teams to capture requirements, define use cases, and develop reusable data models and visualisations.

Champion change management, training, and adoption strategies to embed BI tools across diverse business units.

Collaborate closely with engineering, architecture, and platform teams to ensure performance, security, and data quality across BI systems





Why you are our next Technical Product Manager

A proven track record delivering enterprise BI initiatives in complex environments.

Strong expertise in Power BI (Service, Desktop, DAX, Dataflows), with experience migrating large BI estates from Tableau to Power BI.

Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric, including integration with Synapse, Data Factory, and Lakehouse.

Strong BI data modelling skills (star/snowflake schemas, semantic layers, performance tuning).

Strategic thinker with the ability to drive adoption, influence stakeholders, and manage change.

Strong background in data governance, metadata management, and role-based security principles.

Excellent communicator, able to partner with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Exposure to AI-driven BI features (e.g., Power BI Copilot, automated insights) highly desirable




What's in it for you?

3 days in the office, 2 days remote - with flexible hours to suit!
Inclusive carer neutral paid Parental Leave of up to 16 weeks
Competitive leave including 2 'Connected Leave' days
All Optus employees have access to resources, webinars and support via the ‘Parents at Work portal'
Own your own growth by accessing an extensive online and facilitator led learning catalogue.
Connect at work through our employee-led volunteer groups: Culture Connect, Elevate Women, Disability Network, Express Yourself (LGBTQIA+), United Veterans, Yarn Network, Wellbeing Network and Young Professionals.
Vibrant campus life, variety of facilities including restaurants, cafes, gymnasium, GP, and post office
Free Optus bus from Macquarie University Metro Station (every 6-8 minutes); morning and afternoon!
Keen to see what it's really like to work at Optus? Search #OptusLife on LinkedIn to go behind the scenes




At Optus, we are strengthened by others and that means valuing diversity and saying ‘yes' to embracing individual differences.

We are committed to ensuring that our application process provides an equal employment opportunity to all job seekers, including individuals from diverse gender, cultural and linguistic backgrounds, individuals with a disability, individuals identifying as being part of the LGBTQIA+ community, individuals who may have served in the armed forces or who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander.

We also want to do our best to make our recruitment process inclusive. If you require any adjustments or accessibility support to participate fairly and equitably in the recruitment process, please email AccessibleRecruitment@optus.com.au or call 1800 309 170. We're here to help.

When you contact us, please advise your preferred method of contact and we will be in touch within 48 hours



For more information on Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging at Optus, please visit https://www.optus.com.au/about/inclusion-diversity.

We are hiring a Lead Data Engineer to join our Data & Analytics team. 

  

Purpose: 

Blackmores is on a journey to revamp their Data and Analytics (DNA) landscape to move from diagnostics analytics to predictive and prescriptive analytics. We are bringing in world class tools like Snowflake, Fivetran, Coalesce to build a platform which will enable us to change the DNA of the business and be more data driven. This platform will help us build our data science and Artificial Narrow Intelligence (ANI) capability inhouse. 

  

This role reports to the Head of Group Data & Analytics and is expected to comply with our hybrid work environment of working at least 3 days a week in our NSW offices – either in Surry Hills or Warriewood and 2 days from home.  

  

Responsibilities include:   

Platform Leadership: Lead the design and build of a secure, scalable data platform from scratch, with strong governance and security controls. 

Team Building & Mentorship: Establish and grow a high-performing data platform team, mentoring members in modern engineering practices coupled with capability building and driver of culture change. 

Data Governance: Operationalize data governance principles and promote enterprise-wide data ownership and literacy across the organisation. 

Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with business and technology partners to understand data needs and deliver reliable solutions. 

Data Pipeline Development: Design and implement robust data pipelines for efficient data ingestion, processing, and storage. 

ETL & Data Quality: Build ETL processes and ensure high data quality, reliability, and performance across the platform. 

DevOps & Automation: Apply CI/CD practices using tools like Terraform, GitHub, and GitHub Actions to automate deployments. 

Documentation & Compliance: Maintain clear documentation of data workflows and ensure alignment with governance and compliance standards. 

  

What we offer?   

A role that suits a strategic and hands-on data leader who enjoys building secure, scalable data platforms, drives enterprise-wide data governance. 

Great benefits to support your health and wellbeing, including access to discounted products   

Mental health support for you and your family through our Sonder assistance program   

  

Who are you?   

  

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field; advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.  

Relevant people leadership experience in building capabilities (technical and non-technical), driving change and culture building. Ability to mentor junior and non-technical stakeholders, promoting data literacy and a culture of curiosity and accessibility.  

Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Kafka, with hands-on experience in cloud platforms (e.g., AWS or Azure) and data tools such as Databricks, Snowflake, Coalesce, or DBT.  

Proven track record in designing, building, and maintaining scalable data platforms and pipelines in a fast-paced environment.  

Strong ability to analyze complex data sets, derive insights, and translate business needs into technical solutions.  

Experience with DevOps practices, including continuous integration and deployment, to support automated and reliable data workflows.  

  

  

Blackmores Group is a leading natural health company with proud Australian heritage, with extensive reach across Asia Pacific.  Founded by visionary naturopath Maurice Blackmore in 1932, our vision is to connect every person on earth to the healing power of nature by combining our knowledge of nature and science to deliver quality health solutions to people and their pets everywhere, every day.  
  
Blackmores Group operates in over 12 markets, with headquarters and a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Australia, and offices across South East Asia and China.  

  

Agencies please note: this recruitment assignment is being managed directly by Blackmores Talent Acquisition team. We will reach out to our preferred agency partners if required. Your respect for this process is appreciated.
